text: Kevin Bruce Zeese (October 28, 1955 â€“ September 5, 2020) was an American lawyer and political activist. His work focused on ending the War on Drugs and mass incarceration. He helped organize the 2011 Occupy encampment in Washington, D.C. at Freedom Plaza. He was co-director of Popular Resistance. He ran for the United States Senate in Maryland in 2006. He lost the election to Ben Cardin. He was born in New York City. Zeese died on September 5, 2020 in Baltimore City, Maryland from a heart attack, aged 64. ==References== Category:1955 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:Lawyers from Baltimore Category:American political activists Category:Politicians from New York City Category:Politicians from Baltimore Category:Lawyers from New York City
title: Kevin Zeese
